class.name: Response
class.doc:
Response objects encapsulate a single response from the client (us) to a gcode Command sent by the host. When converted to strings, they typically appear like "ok" or "ok T:153.7"
It was decided to make a thin wrapper around the raw string responses in order to standardize the 'ok', '!!' (error), etc response prefixes.

variable.name: Null
variable.brief: Response::NULL allows one to indicate that no response should be sent

variable.name: Ok
variable.brief: Response::Ok provides easy access to a response formatted as "ok"

methodtemplate.name: Response
methodtemplate.brief: Construct a response from a code, a set of Key:Value pairs, and then an extra string (all 3 are joined by spaced)

argument.name: pairs
argument.doc: is given as any container whose elements are std::pairs<std::string, std::string>, in which std::pair::first is the key, and std::pair::second is the value.

methodtemplate.name: Response
methodtemplate.brief: Construct a response from a code and a set of Key:Value pairs (joined by a space)
methodtemplate.doc: Allow construction, using an std::initializer_list of std::pair<std::string, std::string> (or const char*, etc) for @pairs. Example: Response(ResponseOk, {make_pair("T", "65"), make_pair("B", "20")}) This specialization is only needed in gcc-4.6, where automatic deduction of a std::initializer_list as Container would cause a warning in the other version

constructor.name: Response
constructor.brief: Construct a response from a code, followed by an optional extra string (implicitly joined by a space)

constructor.name: Response
constructor.brief: Construct a response from a code, followed by an optional extra C string (implicitly joined by a space)

method.name: isComment
method.brief: return true if the response represents a comment (a line starting with // ), which the host can safely ignore

method.name: toString
method.brief: Convert the Response object to a string
method.doc: Note: no newline character is appended to the end; the string is a single line of text.
